title: May 14, 2024—KB5037788 (OS Build 10240.20651) - Microsoft Support
text:
May 14, 2024—KB5037788 (OS Build 10240.20651) 
Windows 10

For information about Windows update terminology, see the article about the  
types of Windows updates 
 and the  
monthly quality update types 
. For an overview of Windows 10, version 1507, see its  
update history page 
. 
Highlights 
This update supports the currency change in Croatia from the kuna to the euro. 
Improvements 
This security update includes quality improvements. When you install this KB: 
This update addresses an issue that might affect domain controllers (DC). NTLM authentication traffic might increase. 
If you installed earlier updates, only the new updates contained in this package will be downloaded and installed on your device. 
For more information about security vulnerabilities, please refer to the new  
Security Update Guide 
 website and the  
May 2024 Security Updates 
. 
Known issues in this update 
Microsoft is not currently aware of any issues with this update. 
How to get this update 
Before installing this update 
Microsoft strongly recommends you install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) for your operating system before installing the latest cumulative update (LCU). SSUs improve the reliability of the update process to mitigate potential issues while installing the LCU and applying Microsoft security updates.  For general information about SSUs, see  
Servicing stack updates 
 and  
Servicing Stack Updates (SSU): Frequently Asked Questions 
. 
If you are using Windows Update, the latest SSU ( 
KB5037019 
) will be offered to you automatically. To get the standalone package for the latest SSU, search for it in the  
Microsoft Update Catalog 
.

summary:
KB5037788 is a quality improvement update released on May 14, 2024, targeting Windows 10 (OS Build 10240.20651). This update addresses an issue that may increase NTLM authentication traffic affecting domain controllers. Prior to installing, it is recommended to apply the latest servicing stack update (KB5037019) to enhance the reliability of the update process. The update introduces changes to support Croatia's currency transition from kuna to euro and does not present any known issues at this time. Only new updates in this package will be downloaded and installed if previous updates have already been applied.

**Technical Breakdown**

**Vulnerabilities and Exploits**:
- No specific critical vulnerabilities or high-impact exploits are noted within this update. The focus is primarily on quality improvements rather than security fixes.

**Installation Process and Prerequisites**:
- Before installing KB5037788, ensure the latest SSU (KB5037019) is applied:
    ```
    To install the SSU, use Windows Update:
    - Open Settings -> Update & Security -> Windows Update
    - Click on Check for updates
    ```
- Preferred update channels:
    - Windows Update: Automatic download and installation without user intervention.
    - Microsoft Update Catalog: For standalone package download, access the Microsoft Update Catalog website.
    - WSUS: Sync this update by setting Products and Classifications to:
        ```
        Product: Windows 10
        Classification: Security Updates
        ```
- Installation of the KB5037788 update will occur automatically if using Windows Update or Windows Update for Business, in accordance with existing policies.

**Known Issues**: 
- Currently, there are no known issues associated with this update.
